image.altText: A copy of Tolstoy's War and Peace with the middle cut out of the pages, where a camera is hidden.

props.synopsis: Intelligence agencies, politicians and spies offer support for a proposed National Spy Museum in Canberra, which would portray the nation's history of espionage and pay tribute to those who have spied.

title.children: 'Everybody loves a spy story': National Spy Museum proposed for Canberra

image.altText: A woman in black walks quickly past a camera, accompanied by another woman in black holding files.

props.synopsis: A former Canberra student teacher convicted by a jury of sexual offences against a 15-year-old boy she first met on a teaching practical has been spared jail.

title.children: Former student teacher avoids jail for sexual offences against teen

image.altText: A woman stands with her hands clasped staring at the camera

props.synopsis: The NSW government is asked to explain what it is doing to guarantee and enhance access to abortions at public hospitals after temporary bans at some regional hospitals.

title.children: MLC says abortion policy a 'terrible mess' at NSW public hospitals

image.altText: A digital sign that says "London Circuit Closure 12 March" on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: The eastern side of London Circuit closed last night until late 2026 to allow for light rail construction and footpath improvements, but the businesses affected are feeling positive about the construction "because we'll have a far more modernised area to work from".

title.children: Business owners optimistic as another section of London Circuit closes

image.altText: A can of Coca-Cola with a plus one dollar label on it and two cans of Jim Beam with plus two dollar labels on it.

props.synopsis: When Ukraine's president faced a fiery meeting with Donald Trump at the White House, his plight struck a chord with a couple 16,000 kilometres away in rural Australia.

title.children: Yass Valley cafe imposes US drink tax over Trump's 'schoolyard bullying'

image.altText: A black and white cat sits on a fence post in front of rolling hills

props.synopsis: For thousands of years farmers have kept cats for their talents at catching rats and mice, and now there are calls for people working the land to be able to claim tax deductions their health and upkeep,

title.children: Working dogs are famous but what about working cats?

image.altText: Jacinta Klein

props.synopsis: About 100 undergraduate and Masters teaching students in the ACT are in classrooms without supervision, in a program designed to help with the chronic teacher shortage. But does putting them in the classrooms earlier lead to burn out faster?

title.children: 'There was something missing': The students already teaching

image.altText: A portrait photo of Mayada. She's wearing a flower on her right ear. Has long black hair. There's long grasses behind her.

props.synopsis: Forced into sexual slavery at age 11, Mayada was sold seven times before she escaped ISIS. There are still 2,600 other women and girls missing in captivity today and their families want justice.

title.children: Once used as child sex slaves, women like Mayada are still seeking justice

image.altText: White silhouette cartoon of donald trump next to words 'climate crisis won't stop for a climate denier' on a red background

props.synopsis: While markets and media were chasing Donald Trump’s tariff fiasco last week, something far more important was unfolding in East Palestine, Ohio.

title.children: As Trump abandons climate action, we must accept net zero won't happen

image.altText: People travelling along floodwaters in a small tinny boat.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has reviewed Queensland's flood maps, emergency zones, changes to town planning, and property records to examine how natural disasters are impacting the housing crisis.

title.children: Chasing cheaper housing, the Queensland government sold the flood plain

image.altText: A photo of a scorched sign on a building reading 'pulse'.

props.synopsis: As many as 1,500 people were said to have been attending a concert, east of the country's capital Skopje, when the fire broke out, with pyrotechnics blamed on causing the roof to catch fire.

title.children: Fireworks blamed in nightclub blaze that killed at least 59 in North Macedonia

image.altText: A submarine rising up from the water

props.synopsis: Australians are being assured they will receive the "most advanced warship in the world" under the AUKUS partnership as doubts grow over the nuclear submarine deal.

title.children: US nuclear submarine commander urges Australians to back AUKUS

image.altText: A close up image of Adam Bandt in Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt has called on the government to distance itself from the United States and explore other relationships, as Trade Minister Don Farrell said his American counterpart gave him no assurances about possible future tariffs.

title.children: Greens leader urges end to the AUKUS deal with 'very dangerous' Trump

image.altText: People stand on the rubble of a house hit by a U.S. strike in Saada, Yemen

props.synopsis: The unfolding strikes represent the biggest US military operation in the Middle East since US President Donald Trump took office in January.

title.children: At least 31 people killed after US launches large-scale strikes against Houthis

image.altText: Oscar Piastri, in his racing suit and cap, looking towards the sky

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's hopes of winning the Australian Grand Prix have been dashed after spinning out while running second.

title.children: 'Only got myself to blame': Piastri rues late spin as teammate wins grand prix

image.altText: Four pairs of leather boots lined up on wooden boardwalk

props.synopsis: Why is it so hard to manufacture boots in Australia — and what happened to our once-booming local industry?

title.children: 'RM Williams should be embarrassed': Bootmaker hits back at YouTube critique

image.altText: High school girls at Langford Islamic College move to their next class.

props.synopsis: The decision to hold crucial exams during one of the most sacred periods in the Islamic calendar will put young Muslims "at a clear disadvantage", a leading educator says.

title.children: 'Poor decision' around NAPLAN could disadvantage Muslim students

image.altText: Sonya holds a coffee cup

props.synopsis: A trans woman visiting from the Philippines says she had intimate photos searched through on her phone by authorities at Sydney International Airport, before being detained at Villawood Immigration Detention Centre.

title.children: Trans woman told she would be taken to hotel ended up in detention centre

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Jess Hill poses for a photo on a tan leather sofa wearing a black dress, red lipstick and a serious expression on her face

props.synopsis: A restless period of cancer treatment gave Jess Hill the clarity and courage to finally voice her ideas about why Australia's National Plan for Ending Gender Based Violence is failing.

title.children: When it comes to ending gendered violence, Jess Hill says we're 'tinkering at the edges'

image.altText: Daniel Rioli hugs a teammate and smiles after kicking a goal

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast Suns record the biggest win in club history, putting a woeful West Coast to the sword in new coach Andrew McQualter's first game.

title.children: King hanger the highlight as Suns record biggest win in club history

image.altText: Toby Sexton looks at Matt Burton on the ground

props.synopsis: Bulldogs lose Matt Burton and Viliame Kikau to knee injuries despite thrashing the Gold Coast Titans at Belmore. Earlier, the Wests Tigers thrashed the Parramatta Eels 32-6.

title.children: Bulldogs count cost of victory over Titans as two stars suffer knee injuries

image.altText: Anthony Albanese stands behind a lectern looking stern.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has reiterated Australia's support for Ukraine after attending a virtual meeting with other world leaders to drum up support for ceasefire discussions.

title.children: Labor and Coalition reiterate opposing stances on Ukraine peacekeeping

image.altText: a group of workers wearing  masks inside the tunnelling phase of the m6 road construction

props.synopsis: A 32-year-old is among 13 Sydney workers who have been diagnosed with silicosis, as the union slams the state's workplace regulator for failing to police the industry.

title.children: 'Shocking' number of tunnel workers diagnosed with deadly silicosis

image.altText: An older man stands in a colourful gay bar smiling.

props.synopsis: Three well-known Oxford Street gay bars are being put forward for heritage status in recognition of their contribution to Sydney's queer history.

title.children: Iconic Sydney gay bars put forward for heritage listing

image.altText: Sign at anti-salmon farming event at Verona Sands beach.

props.synopsis: A month on from salmon chunks washing ashore, opponents to industrial fish farming have gathered at the site to repeat their call for the practice to be stopped — with Tasmania's Premier adamant a "majority" still support the industry.

title.children: Premier again backs salmon farms as protesters visit site of dead fish wash up

image.altText: A newsreader with a digital mask over her face.

props.synopsis: Detectors that are used to uncover deepfake images have ‘major vulnerabilities’ when used on videos they weren’t trained on, and can't keep up with the volume of AI images being generated, a new study suggests.

title.children: 'We should be pretty worried': Even AI struggles to tell fake from real content

image.altText: Woman holding phone looks into camera

props.synopsis: Advocates say a more resilient telecommunications network is needed to ensure vulnerable people aren't left stranded during natural disasters.

title.children: Calls for disaster resilient mobile network as cyclone leaves 250,000 cut off

image.altText: Gout Gout crosses the line in the 200m at the Queensland Athletics Championships.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout breaks 20 seconds for the 200 metres, but his time will not stand as a national record due to the assistance of an illegal wind reading.

title.children: Gout Gout dips under 20 seconds for 200m with illegal tailwind

image.altText: Deb Gray pictured in hospital with a copy of her memoir

props.synopsis: From hanging out with rockstars and road-tripping across America to becoming a mum, Deb Gray led a remarkable life.

title.children: Deb Gray was a 'medical curiosity' to some but she didn't let it slow her down

image.altText: Serving bowl of potato salad with chives and shallot, a summer salad to bring to festive feasts.

props.synopsis: Potatoes are one of the world's most common vegetables, yet they are probably the most misunderstood.

title.children: Myths around the health benefits of potatoes are being questioned

image.altText: A woman with a swim cap swims with her arms in front her from right to left with a lane line below her.

props.synopsis: Sisters Diane and Lorraine's fear of the water has had a profound impact on their lives. Jacqueline Wong, who teaches adults to swim, says aquaphobia is the most "common thread" connecting her clients, but it can be overcome.

title.children: Girt by sea and desperate to avoid it: Fear of water is 'common'

image.altText: couple looking at computer together on the couch

props.synopsis: A basic understanding of available science-backed treatments can be helpful when navigating the world of infertility. We look at what's available, the costs, and when alternatives to IVF might be relevant for you.

title.children: IVF alternatives, how much they cost, and if they're right for you
